info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 1:22PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT ROOSEVELT...SOUTHEASTERN QUAY AND CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 145 PM MST... At 121 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Tucumcari to near Elida. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clovis, Portales, Tucumcari, Quay, Texico, Melrose, San Jon, Elida, Dora, and Grady. This includes State Road 104 near Mile Marker 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area. Accumulations of graupel or small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
